page.title: 04*NEW INDUSTRY IN S.HETTON*
page.content: In the mid-1970's the District Council began a scheme to construct 15 Nursery Factory units of 75sq/m and 4 additional larger units of 135 sq/m. The general scheme was to reduce the effects of possible future loss of mining jobs , a future which unfortunately has now become a reality. The factories occupy a site which was previously the site of the original eight rows of terrace houses which formed the nucleus of the original mining village. The site is now being extended and will hopefully alleviate to some extent the job losses and economic problems resulting from the closure of South Hetton colliery.
